t: Ecclesiastes 10
Dead*pn flies make the perfumer’s ointment give off a stench; so*ld a little folly outweighs wisdom and honor.
A*ln wise man’s heart inclines him to the right, but*ld a fool’s heart to the left.
Even*ln when the fool walks on the road, he lacks sense, and*ld he says to everyone that he is a fool.
If*ln the anger of the ruler rises against you, do not leave your place, for*ld calmness will lay great offenses to rest.
There*p is an evil that I have seen under the sun, as it were an error proceeding from the ruler:
folly is set in many high places, and the rich sit in a low place.
I have seen slaves on horses, and princes walking on the ground like slaves.
He*pn who digs a pit will fall into it, and*ld a serpent will bite him who breaks through a wall.
He*ln who quarries stones is hurt by them, and*ld he who splits logs is endangered by them.
If*ln the iron is blunt, and one does not sharpen the edge, he*ld must use more strength, but*ld wisdom helps one to succeed.
If*ln the serpent bites before it is charmed, there*ld is no advantage to the charmer.
The*pn words of a wise man’s mouth win him favor, but*ld the lips of a fool consume him.
The*ln beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness, and*ld the end of his talk is evil madness.
A*ln fool multiplies words, though*ld no man knows what is to be, and*ld who can tell him what will be after him?
The*ln toil of a fool wearies him, for*ld he does not know the way to the city.
Woe*pn to you, O land, when your king is a child, and*ld your princes feast in the morning!
Happy*ln are you, O land, when your king is the son of the nobility, and*ld your princes feast at the proper time, for*ld strength, and not for drunkenness!
Through*ln sloth the roof sinks in, and*ld through indolence the house leaks.
Bread*ln is made for laughter, and*ld wine gladdens life, and*ld money answers everything.
Even*ln in your thoughts, do not curse the king, nor*ld in your bedroom curse the rich, for*ln a bird of the air will carry your voice, or*ld some winged creature tell the matter.
